definitions.definition: To assess the similarities and differences between two or more things ["to compare X with Y"]. Having made the comparison of X with Y, one might have found it similar to Y or different from Y.
examples: Compare the tiger's coloration with that of the zebra.
You can't compare my problems and yours.

definitions.definition: To declare two things to be similar in some respect ["to compare X to Y"].
examples: Astronomers have compared comets to dirty snowballs.

definitions.definition: To form the three degrees of comparison of (an adjective).
To be similar ( often used in the negative ).
examples: A sapling and a fully-grown oak tree do not compare .

main_definition: ( transitive ) To assess the similarities and differences between two or more things ["to compare X with Y"]. Having made the comparison of X with Y, one might have found it similar to Y or different from Y.
secondary_definitions: ( transitive ) To declare two things to be similar in some respect ["to compare X to Y"].
( transitive , grammar ) To form the three degrees of comparison of (an adjective).
( intransitive ) To be similar ( often used in the negative ).
